===Etymology===
Compound of {{compound|lang=ja|sort=ねつけ|根|tr1=ne|t1=root, base|付け|tr2=tsuke|t2=attachment, attacher}}, the {{m|ja|連用形|tr=ren'yōkei||continuative or stem form}} of verb {{m|ja|付ける|tr=tsukeru||to attach}}, from the way the ''netsuke'' was attached to the end of the drawstring of a coin purse or pouch to prevent the drawstring from slipping through one's {{m|ja|帯|tr=obi||sash, belt}}.<ref name="KDJ">{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}}</ref><ref name="DJR">{{R:Daijirin}}</ref>

See the {{m|ja|提げ物|tr=sagemono}} entry for an illustration of how ''netsuke'' were used.

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|ねつけ}}

# A [[netsuke]]; miniature sculptures that serve as a fastener for a [[sagemono]] (a [[pouch]], like a [[coin purse]], tobacco pouch, or [[pillbox]]).
